arts.ttl: Transfer news and rumours today: Romain Esse to Crystal Palace, Woyo Coulibaly to Leicester, Philip Billing to Napoli
arts.sum: Sports Mole rounds up the latest transfer news and rumours, including Romain Esse to Crystal Palace, Woyo Coulibaly to Leicester City and Philip Billing to Napoli.

arts.ttl: Bournemouth's Billing seals loan move to Napoli
arts.sum: Philip Billing has joined Serie A side Napoli from Bournemouth on loan for the rest of the season, the Italian club announced on Saturday.

arts.ttl: Andoni Iraola lauds wide players as Bournemouth thrash West Brom
arts.sum: Justin Kluivert, Dango Ouattara and Antoine Semenyo scored for the Cherries.

arts.ttl: Bournemouth come from behind to beat managerless West Brom
arts.sum: Dango Ouattara scored twice as stylish Bournemouth came from behind to beat managerless West Brom and move into the FA Cup fourth round.

arts.ttl: Dango Ouattara bags brace as five-star Bournemouth wallop West Brom
arts.sum: Caleb Taylor had given the Baggies an early lead.

arts.ttl: Video: Billing completes Napoli medical ahead of transfer from Bournemouth

arts.ttl: Dango Ouattara bags brace as five-star Bournemouth wallop West Brom

arts.ttl: Club want Bournemouth man signed by start of next week – Deal ‘close but not closed’
arts.sum: Valencia intend to have Bournemouth’s Max Aarons in place at the club next week but won’t sign anything until he’s undergone a medical. That’s according to AS, who say the defender’s inclusion in Bournemouth’s starting 11 does not impede his impending move to Valencia. arts.ttl: Chelsea v Morecambe, Leicester v QPR, and more: FA Cup third round – clockwatch
arts.sum: Updates from the 3pm GMT kick-offs Live scoreboard | Get in touch with Tom Ilias Chair is the first QPR player to test Jakub Stolarczyk, who saves well, but the Leicester keeper cannot do anything about Jonathan Varane’s effort. QPR had turned up the heat in the previous five minutes or so and after Harry Winks failed to clear, Varane gathered the ball and slammed it low and into the bottom corner from all of 25 yards. Nottingham Forest: Carlos Miguel, Toffolo, Boly, Morato, Alex, Moreira, Ward-Prowse, Jota Silva, Yates, Sosa, Awoniyi. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Friday development brings Bournemouth defender close to January move – Exit ‘one step away’
arts.sum: Valencia have identified AFC Bournemouth’s Max Aarons as their main target to strengthen defence in the winter market. On Friday, Super Deporte reported the right-back has attracted interest from the Premier League but wants to join Los Ches.
